result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel A. Fitzgerald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel A. Fitzgerald
Current: 307 1/2 N 8th St, Watertown, WI 53094 United States  (Effective: 11-23-2016)
Prior: 163 W Rockwell, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States

Cases 15CM512 and 15CM435 called at 8:15am.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Daniel A. Fitzgerald in court with attorney David Westrick.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing recommendations presented by counsel. 
Statement presented by the defendant. 
The Court presents basis for findings and orders. 
The Court orders:
15CM435 - Count #1:
-  $1555.50 on a pay plan of $25 per month starting 11/28/2016.  Failure to pay as ordered will result in 31 days jail consecutive with Huber. 

15CM512 - Count #2:
-  $705 on the same pay plan as case 15CM435.  Failure to pay as ordered will result in 14 days jail consecutive with Huber. 

Counsel indicate that a DNA sample is already on file.  Court does not require that another sample be provided.
Sentencing hearing on October 28, 2016 at 08:10 am.
with elements
Criminal Case Settlement

[MK] cases #15CM435 and #15CM512 called at 11:15am. 
Defendant Daniel A. Fitzgerald in court with Attorney David Westrick.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber indicates that victim rights compliance is not applicable in these cases. 
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr. Fitzgerald.    
After Mr. Fitzgerald cites his short-term memory and long-term memory issues and that he cannot recall a portion of his discussion with Attorney Westrick, the Court adjourns briefly. 
recess 11:20am, reconvene 11:28am.
Mr. Fitzgerald indicates that he is prepared to enter his pleas. 
Pleas of " No Contest " entered on Case #15CM435-Count #1 and on Case #15CM512-Count #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Fitzgerald guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Case #15CM512-Count #1. 

On Motion of the Defense, the Court schedules Sentencing on a later date. 
recess 11:35am. 

NEXT:  Sentencing Hearing on 10/28/16 at 8:10am
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.

[MK] cases #15CM435 and #15CM512 called at 8:48am. 
Defendant Daniel A. Fitzgerald in court with Attorney David Westrick.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance in both cases.
Attorney Westrick confirms that he has gone over the examining psychologist's report with Mr. Fitzgerald.  Attorney Westrick indicates that the case should be scheduled for plea and sentencing a few weeks out, to allow Mr. Fitzgerald time to prepare. 
recess 8:54am. 

NEXT:  both cases set for Plea & Sentencing on 9/26/16 at 11:15am.
Invoice received from Dr. Engen on 8-1-2016 - Approved
received from Dr. Engen
Status conference on August 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Cases 15CM435 and 15CM512 called together at 9:02am [mo]
Defendant Daniel A. Fitzgerald in court with Attorney David Westrick.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Westrick indicates that a NGI pleas has been entered, and the report has not yet been filed, further Atty. Westrick indicates that Mr. Fitzgerald has undergone the consultation.
At the direction of the Court, the Clerk attempts to contact Court Liaison(unable to reach via office or cell)
The Court sent email to Court Liaison and Assistant Court Liaison, and copied both ADA Teuber and Atty. Westrick to advise of the late report and to advise of new hearing date; Court directs Clerk to mark as Exhibit #1. 

recess: 9:31am

Status conference on July 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Cases 15CM435 and 15CM512 called together at 11:20am [mo]
Defendant Daniel A. Fitzgerald in court with Attorney David Westrick.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Fitzgerald. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Atty. Westrick enters a not gulty by reason by mental disease or defect
The Court directs to prepare the proper form
The Court and Counsel discuss future scheuling.
recess: 11:35am

Cases 15CM512 and 15CM435 called together at 2:10pm [mo]
Defendant Daniel A. Fitzgerald appears via video conferencing from the Jefferson County jail, in custody.
Attorney David Westrick appears in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.
 
Initial Appearnce occurs in case 15CM512 and Adjourned Initial Appearance occurs in Case 15CM435:

As to Both Cases:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $1000  signature bond, with conditions: 
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug parapherbalia without a valid prescription
